subject: Re: Using JMock, example of the after() MatchBuilder?
msgSnippet: I think I know what s up! I was reading the changelist wrong. I thought the change list was saying the new exactly() method was in version-1.0.1 but it appears
messageBody:
I think I know what's up! I was reading the changelist wrong. I
thought the change list was saying the new exactly() method was in
version-1.0.1 but it appears above the version-1.0.1 title which, I
guess, means that it's in a later version. I'll look into the snapshot
version. I know it'll be in there. I just get a little leary using
snapshots and/or nightly builds.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "cliftonccraig" <cliftonccraig@y...> wrote:
> Wait a minute here! I did have version 1.0.1 all along! Idea didn't
> seem to be picking up the exactly() method. So then I go and download
> the latest stable version from the site again (version-1.0.1) and
> still I see no exactly method. The funny thing is that the method was
> in the docs the whole time I don't know how/why I missed it there.
> Anyhow, it does me no good in the docs if it's not in the meat. I
> tried 1st thing this morning dowl=nloading version-1.0.1 and
> introspecting the jar in BeanShell to see if I could find the exactly
> method on org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase and this is what I got:
> bsh % bsh % addClassPath("c:\\Program
> Files\\IntelliJ-IDEA-4.0.3\\lib\\junit.jar");
> bsh % addClassPath("d:/scm/tools/jmock-1.0.1/lib/jmock-1.0.1.jar");
> bsh % show();
> <true>
> bsh % methods(org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.class);
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase
> {
> public org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase(java.lang.String)
> public org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase()
> public org.jmock.core.Stub
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.throwException(java.lang.Throwable)
> public org.jmock.Mock
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.mock(java.lang.Class)
> public org.jmock.Mock
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.mock(java.lang.Class,java.lang.String)
> protected org.jmock.core.DynamicMock
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.newCoreMock(java.lang
> .Class,java.lang.String)
> public java.lang.String
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.defaultMockNameForType(java.lang.Class)
> public org.jmock.core.Stub
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.returnValue(boolean)
> public org.jmock.core.Stub
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.returnValue(java.lang.Object)
> public org.jmock.core.Stub
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.returnValue(char)
> public org.jmock.core.Stub
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.returnValue(short)
> public org.jmock.core.Stub
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.returnValue(int)
> public org.jmock.core.Stub
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.returnValue(long)
> public org.jmock.core.Stub
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.returnValue(float)
> public org.jmock.core.Stub
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.returnValue(double)
> public org.jmock.core.Stub
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.returnValue(byte)
> public org.jmock.core.InvocationMatcher
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.once()
> public org.jmock.core.InvocationMatcher
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.atLeastOnce()
> public org.jmock.core.InvocationMatcher
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.never()
> public org.jmock.core.Stub
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.onConsecutiveCalls(or
> g.jmock.core.Stub,org.jmock.core.Stub,org.jmo
> ck.core.Stub)
> public org.jmock.core.Stub
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.onConsecutiveCalls(or
> g.jmock.core.Stub,org.jmock.core.Stub,org.jmo
> ck.core.Stub,org.jmock.core.Stub)
> public org.jmock.core.Stub
> org.jmock.MockObjectTestCase.onConsecutiveCalls(or
> g.jmock.core.Stub,org.jmock.core.Stub)
> }
> bsh %
>
> So what gives? This is the download link I followed:
> http://dist.codehaus.org/jmock/jars/jmock-1.0.1.jar
>
> I cannot find the exactly method in there. Is the site mixed up? Is
> there a later version that I'm not award of? Am I looking in the wrong
> place? (Is it not in
> jar://jmock-1.0.1.jar!org/jmock/MockObjectTestCase.class?) I'm still
> stuck!
>
> Cliff
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "cliftonccraig" <cliftonccraig@y...>
> wrote:
> > J.B.,
> >
> > I was just getting ready to respond and tell you that you're full of
> > fluff then I though of checking the latest version. I have version
> > 1.0.0. It looks like version 1.0.1 has the elusive exactly()
> method. I
> > just downloaded my version so this new change must have happened in
> > the past week or so. Oh well. It's late now and I have to go get my
> > daughter from day care. I'll pick up on this tomorrow. Thanx J.B.!
> >
> > Cliff
> > BTW:
> > I was toying with the after() and onConsecutiveCalls() stuff and I
> > started getting some interesting but inconsistent results. I'll
> write
> > back tomorrow.
